sentences: David Andrew Sitek (born September 6, 1972) is an American musician and record producer, known for his work with his band TV on the Radio.

He has also worked with bands such as Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Liars, Foals, Celebration, Little Dragon, Beady Eye, and Weezer, and produced free jazz-influenced remixes of songs by artists such as Beck and Nine Inch Nails, and has contributed a solo track to the Red Hot Organization Dark Was the Night charity compilation.
Born in 1972, Sitek grew up in Columbia, Maryland, together with his brothers.
Sitek developed an interest in music at an early age influenced by his "aunt Paula [who] sneaked out of the house [to see] Jimi Hendrix in the 1960s, and was really into Talking Heads and Blondie".

Our Lady Peace – Spiritual Machines II (TBA)Though Sitek has collaborated with several Brooklyn-based indie bands, he looks upon the indie music movement with skepticism.

In an interview with the Danish music magazine Soundvenue, he explained that he is dissatisfied with the opportunistic turn music has taken, referring to the self-promoting indie bands moving to Brooklyn only to claim that they are from "the creative mecca" in order to get the attention of music magazines.
This may explain why Sitek has settled down on the West coast in Beverly Hills, California.
It's a very egocentric city.
